articles.title: EU firms aim to de-risk as they reassess ‘how many eggs to keep’ in China - South China Morning Post
articles.description: Business-confidence survey among European Union Chamber of Commerce members in China shows a record-low share of firms planning to expand in the world’s second-largest economy this year.

articles.author: Tereza Pultarova
articles.title: European probe captures stunning up-close views of planet Mercury during brief flyby (video, photos) - Space.com
articles.description: The flyby took Europe's BepiColombo spacecraft within 150 miles (240 kilometers) of Mercury's surface.
articles.content:
Europe's Mercury-bound probe BepiColombo made its third close flyby of its target planet on Monday (June 19), revealing a surface riddled with craters, including one that just received a name.

articles.title: Is food inflation higher in Europe than in the UK? - BBC
articles.description: Food prices are growing faster in the UK than in Germany, Portugal or Sweden.
articles.content:
UK food prices are rising at a slower rate than other countries, according to government minister Mel Stride. 
But is he right?

articles.description: ESA’s Euclid gets fuelled inside an Astrotech facility near Cape Canaveral in Florida (USA) ahead of its launch on a SpaceX Falcon 9.
